body:
`--wait` did not work in alpha.1 which is probably why you didn't see any stack traces. Looks like it occurs when waiting for a statefulset to become ready.

cc @thomastaylor312
Thanks for reporting this @morsok! Anyway you could provide me the chart you were using that caused this panic to occur?

This is a custom chart for a symfony app that has rabbitmq-ha / redis-ha /
postgresql (master slave replication) / mailhog and mercure from the stable
repository.

Ping me tomorrow on slack and I'll send you the full chart,nothing fancy
the custom part is a deployment with some hook for database fixtures and
migrations.

Le mer. 7 août 2019 à 19:01, Taylor Thomas <notifications@github.com> a
écrit :

> Thanks for reporting this @morsok <https://github.com/morsok>! Anyway you
> could provide me the chart you were using that caused this panic to occur?
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/6174?email_source=notifications&email_token=AAMLAOW7V7N4BPMXQ25M2NDQDL5VJA5CNFSM4IKCFO42YY3PNVWWK3TUL52HS4DFVREXG43VMVBW63LNMVXHJKTDN5WW2ZLOORPWSZGOD3ZB3IA#issuecomment-519183776>,

issue.title: fix(kube): Fixes nil panic with stateful set waiting

labels.name: size/XS
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 0-9 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

labels.name: v3.x
labels.description: Issues and Pull Requests related to the major version v3

issue.body:
Sometimes the stateful set `rollingUpdate` field can be nil even when the strategy is a rolling update

Fixes #6174

body: @morsok I actually think I was able to figure it out just from the stack trace. Can you please give #6175 a try and see if it fixes the issue for you?

Sadly when testing with the dev branch (helm.sh/helm/internal/version.gitCommit=ad9c0c440b9f0bd84548ba82c35a9ec7958cdab8) all I got was : 

```
Deploying new release...
Release "RELEASENAME" does not exist. Installing it now.
Error: failed pre-install: 
```
Also I had to do a helm repo add for the https://kubernetes-charts.storage.googleapis.com, but maybe it's normal on the dev branch.

Is there any way I can help you test that further ?

@morsok That looks like a different bug. Did you get the same panic and stack trace or did something else happen?

As for the repo add, that is now the intended behavior on Helm 3, especially because the stable URL is likely to be changing

@thomastaylor312 No I didn't get the same panic I had the failed pre-install instead.

Thanks for the heads up i'll adapt my scripts to add the stable URL.
So I think it is a different issue then @morsok. You ok if I close this issue then? If the other bug is still giving you problems, feel free to open another issue and we'll take a look
It would be best if someone can test with a chart that has a statefulset in it's dependencies but yeah i'm ok to close this one i'll open another right away, thank you :)

issue.title: Helm V3 : failed pre-install

labels.name: v3.x
labels.description: Issues and Pull Requests related to the major version v3

issue.body:
When testing with the dev branch after #6174 (helm.sh/helm/internal/version.gitCommit=ad9c0c440b9f0bd84548ba82c35a9ec7958cdab8) all I got was :

Deploying new release...
Release "RELEASENAME" does not exist. Installing it now.
Error: failed pre-install: 

Not sure if gitlab ate the rest of the error (seeing some weird issues since I upgraded it) or if this is all I got.

I'm willing to take time on slack to guide you on my setup or transfer the chart I use if that helps.
